gurmukhi: kwhy kau kwnH AXoDn mY ihq AOrn ky irs kY rn pwro ] kwhy kau Gwie sho qn mY puin kw ky khy Air BUpin mwro ]
transliteration: Kaahe Kau Kaahn Ayodhan Mai Hit Auran Ke Ris Kai Ran Daro|| Kaahe Kau Ghaae Saho Tan Mai Poun(i) Kaa Ke Kahe Ar(i) Bhaapan(i) Daro||
translation: “O Krishna ! why are you waging war in great anger? Why are you enduring wounds on your body? On whose bidding you are killing the kings?

gurmukhi: jIvq ho jb lau jg mYN qb lau muih sMig iBirXo n ibcwro ] suMdr jwnkY Cwfq ho qij kY rn sXwm jU Dwm isDwro ]1215]
transliteration: Jeevat Ho Jab Lau Jag Main Tab Lau Moub(i) San(i) Bhiriyo Na Bicdaro|| Soundar Jaan-kai Chhaadat Ho Taj(i) Kai Ran Syaam Joo Dhaam Siddaro||1215||
translation: “You will remain alive only if you do not fight with me; considering you beautiful, I condone you; therefore leave the war-arena and go to your home.”1215.

gurmukhi: Pyr AXoDn pY iris kY Aimtys blI ieh BwNiq aucwro ] bYs ikSor mno hir mUrq lYho khw liK ju`D hmwro ]
transliteration: Pher Ayodhan Pai Ris(i) Kai Amites Balieh Bhaant(i) Oucdaro|| Bais Kishor Mano Har(i) Moondat Laiho Kahaa Lakh(i) Juddh Hadaro||
translation: Amit Singh spoke again in the battlefield, “Still you rage is much less and it will be of no value to you, if you see me fighting;

gurmukhi: hau qum isau hir swcu kihE qum jau ijX mY kCu Aaur ibcwro ] kY hm sMig lro qij kY fr kY Apny sB AwXuD fwro ]1216]
transliteration: Hau Toum Sio Har(i) Saach Kahio Toum Jau Jiya Mai Kachhodh Aur Bicdaro|| Kai Ham San(i) Daro Taj(i) Kai Dar Kai Apne Sabh Aayudh Daro||1216||
translation: “O Krishna ! I am telling you the truth, but you are thinking something else in your mind; you may now either fight with me fearlessly or throw away all your weapons.1216.

gurmukhi: Awju AXoDn mY qum ko hinho qumrI sB hI pRqnw ko ] jau ry koaU qum mY Bt hY bhu Awvq hY ibiD Awhv jw ko ]
transliteration: Ooj(u) Ayodhan Mai Toum Ko Haniho Toumrisabh Hipratnaa Ko|| Jou Re Ko( i)  Toum Mai Bhat Kai Bahu Aavat Hai Bidh(i) Aahav Jaa Ko||
translation: “I shall kill you and all your army today in the battlefield; if there is any heroic fighter amongst you and if someone knows the art of warfare, then he should come forward to fight with me;

gurmukhi: so hmry sMg Awie iBrY n lrY prmySr kI shu qw ko ] jo tir hY ieh Awhv qy soeI isMG nhI Bt sXwr khw ko ]1217]
transliteration: So Hamre San Aae Bhidai Na Darai Parmeshar Kisahu Taa Ko|| Jo Tar(i) Hai Eh Aahav Te Soisingh Nahibhat Syaar Kahaa Ko||1217||
translation: “I swear by God that I shall not fight with you; if anyone recedes from this war, he will not be called a lion, but only a jackal.”1217.

gurmukhi: Aimt isMG ky bcn suin hirjU kRoD bKwie ] SsqR sBY kir mY ley snmuiK phucXo Dwie ]1218]
transliteration: Amit Singh Ke Bachanndsoun(i) Har(i) Joo Krodh Bakhaae|| Shastra Sabhai Kar(i) Mai Lae Sanmoukh(i) Pahouchyo Dhaae||1218||
translation: Hearing the words of Amit Singh and in great anger, carrying all his weapons in his hands, Krishna reached in front of Amit Singh.1218.

gurmukhi: Awvq sXwm ko pyK blI Apny mn mY Aiq kop bFwXo ] cwro eI Gorin Gwiel kY sr qICn dwrk ky aur lwXo ]
transliteration: Oovat Syaam Ko Pekh Baliapne Man Mai At(i) Kop Badhaayo|| Chdaro Ighoran(i) Ghaail Kai Sar Teechhan Daarak Ke Ur Laayo||
translation: Seeing Krishna coming, that mighty warrior got highly enraged; he wounded all the four horses of Krishna and inflicted a sharp arrow in the bosom of Daruk;

gurmukhi: dUsry qIr so kwnH srIr su kop hnXo joaU TOr qkwXo ] sXwm khY Aimtys mno jdbIr kI dyh ko l`C bnwXo ]1219]
transliteration: Doosre Teer So Kaahn Dareer Su Kop Hanyo Jooo Tharur Takaayo|| Syaam Kahai Amites Mano Jadbeer Kideh Ko Lachchh Banaayo||1219||
translation: He discharged the second arrow on Krishna, seeing him in front of himself; the poet says that Amit Singh made Krishna as the target.1219.
